content:
That's great to hear! It's amazing how fixing up your acoustic guitar has sparked a new wave of creativity and inspiration. Playing every day is a great way to keep the momentum going and improve your skills.

I'm intrigued by your idea of a harmonica journal. That's a fantastic way to track your progress, explore different techniques, and even develop your own style. Writing down your thoughts, ideas, and insights can help you reflect on your playing and identify areas for improvement.

You might consider including things like:

* Notes on specific techniques you're working on, like bends or trills
* Chord progressions or songs you're learning
* Ideas for harmonica riffs or solos
* Inspiration from other harmonica players or genres
* Goals and challenges for yourself

Having a harmonica journal can also help you stay motivated and focused. It's a great way to celebrate your progress and reflect on how far you've come.

Do you have any favorite blues artists or harmonica players who inspire you?
